decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the board with counterspells and card draw while setting up a combo with Tolarian Terror, Cryptic Serpent, and Lórien Revealed to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a powerful finish. The deck relies on efficient card filtering and graveyard manipulation to dig for combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By efficiently managing resources and timing spells, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and outpace the opponent for a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize low-cost, efficient creatures and spells to apply constant pressure on the opponent. With a mix of creature removal, artifact destruction, and card draw, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady stream of threats on the board. The inclusion of cards like Krark-Clan Shaman and Cast Down help to control the board, while cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Cleansing Wildfire provide additional resources and flexibility. Overall, this deck focuses on aggression and resource management to overwhelm the opponent.

The focus of this deck is to apply consistent pressure on the opponent through aggressive creature plays and removal spells. By using a combination of efficient creatures like Gixian Infiltrator and Nyxborn Hydra, alongside removal spells like Cast Down and Krark-Clan Shaman, this deck aims to control the board while dealing damage steadily to the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Cleansing Wildfire and Twisted Landscape helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and keep the pressure on. Overall, this deck aims to maintain a strong presence on the battlefield and outpace the opponent in a Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and combat tricks to deal damage quickly and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes a mix of cheap creatures like Glint Hawk and Thraben Inspector, along with removal spells like Cast Down to control the board. The Orzhov color combination allows for a mix of white's aggressive creatures and black's removal spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures while disrupting their plans with cards like Pactdoll Terror. The combination of aggression and disruption makes it a powerful deck in the Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures and using combos like Balustrade Spy and Dread Return to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard. By utilizing cards like Axebane Guardian and Overgrown Battlement to generate mana, the deck can quickly combo off and overwhelm the opponent. The strategy revolves around setting up the graveyard with cards like Land Grant and Lead the Stampede, then using powerful creatures like Lotleth Giant and Sagu Wildling to finish off the opponent in one devastating turn. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can respond.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board using a combination of Gates and powerful enchantments. By utilizing cards like Basilisk Gate and Journey to Nowhere to remove threats, along with Counterspell to protect your own creatures, you can establish dominance on the battlefield. Lórien Revealed and The Modern Age provide card advantage, while Squadron Hawk and Sacred Cat offer recurring threats. Azorius Guildgate and Island provide the mana base needed to support the control strategy, while Outlaw Medic and Guardian of the Guildpact offer additional protection and utility.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using a combination of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Fireblast, and Fiery Temper, along with creatures like Guttersnipe, Kessig Flamebreather, and Voldaren Epicure. Additional card draw and damage is generated through cards like Faithless Looting, Lava Dart, Highway Robbery, Sneaky Snacker, and Grab the Prize. By aggressively burning the opponent's life total and controlling the board with efficient creatures, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This RDW Pauper deck focuses on quick aggressive plays with low-cost creatures and burn spells. Clockwork Percussionist and Reckless Lackey provide early pressure, while Goblin Tomb Raider and Voldaren Epicure keep the aggression going. Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt offer efficient removal while also pushing damage to the opponent's face. Goldhound and Gingerbrute help maintain pressure and provide evasive threats. The inclusion of Great Furnace and Inventor's Axe support the artifact subtheme, while Reckless Abandon offers a finisher option. Sylvok Lifestaff provides lifegain to help sustain early aggression.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm and defeat the opponent by playing low-cost, efficient creatures and controlling the game with counterspells. The deck focuses on consistently drawing and playing creatures such as Tolarian Terror and Cryptic Serpent, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Counterspell and Force Spike. By maintaining a fast pace and applying pressure early on, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure a victory before they can establish their own board presence.

The Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying efficient creatures like Kor Skyfisher and Novice Inspector, backed up by removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Journey to Nowhere. The deck aims to apply pressure early and often, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Relic of Progenitus. The inclusion of life gain lands like Radiant Fountain and utility lands like Kabira Crossroads helps to stabilize against aggressive opponents, while cards like Prismatic Strands and Melded Moxite provide protection and evasion. Overall, the deck prioritizes aggression and disruption to overwhelm opponents.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost artifact creatures and using cards like Galvanic Blast and Krark-Clan Shaman to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Makeshift Munitions and Fanatical Offering to sacrifice artifacts for additional benefits. The combination of artifact creatures, sacrifice outlets, and efficient removal spells allows this deck to apply pressure early in the game and maintain aggression throughout. Additionally, cards like Nihil Spellbomb provide graveyard hate against opponent strategies that rely on recursion. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful Affinity strategy.

The deck focuses on using low-cost white creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. It also includes cards that provide additional value for the creatures, such as Prismatic Strands for protection and Battle Screech for additional creature tokens. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game, utilizing a combination of efficient creatures and combat tricks to outpace the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's plans and maintain full control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. Using cards like Counterspell, Snuff Out, and Spellstutter Sprite, the deck aims to counter or remove threats while gradually gaining card advantage with cards like Deep Analysis. The deck also includes some efficient creatures like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Augur of Bolas to apply pressure and maintain board presence. The overall strategy is to control the game until the opponent runs out of resources, allowing the Dimir Control player to take over and win the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of gates to generate mana and ramp into powerful spells, while also using countermagic and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes cards like Brainstorm and Squadron Hawk for card advantage, Citadel and Basilisk Gates for mana fixing, and cards like Counterspell and Journey to Nowhere to control the board. The deck also includes some lifegain and defensive cards like Sacred Cat and Guardian of the Guildpact to survive against aggressive decks.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through counterspells and removal while using card draw and creatures with evasion to maintain card advantage and pressure. The deck includes a mix of cheap removal, counterspells, and efficient creatures to disrupt the opponent's strategy and take control of the game. The deck also includes cards that provide card advantage and ways to protect the player's life total, ensuring a steady stream of resources and answers to threats.

The deck focuses on quickly building up a board of Elves to overwhelm the opponent with swarming, efficient creatures and generating a large amount of mana. By utilizing cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic for ramp, along with Priest of Titania for further mana production, the deck aims to play powerful creatures like Nyxborn Hydra and Timberwatch Elf early in the game. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help to refill the hand with more Elves, while Generous Ent and Wellwisher provide additional support and resilience.
